page.title: 07GAYTON'S BAKERY
page.content: The bakery in Maypole Lane was founded in 1921 by two brothers,Bill and Thomas Gayton.It employs 13 people and takes on 2 extra schoolgirls on Saturday.It bakes every day and uses 5 tons of flour a week making bread, rolls,buns,cakes and wedding cakes. Until 1960 the bakery traded only in Baddesley and Grendon.Now it has a wholesale trade delivery to other villages including shops in Atherstone Wilnecote,Dosthill,Woodend, Hurley, Baxterley and Birchley Heath.It still maintains a retail trade delivering bread by van to houses in Baddesley and Grendon.The price of a standard loaf of bread from the van is 48p. The majority of the flour used is milled at Tewksbury.In all the years of its existence the bakery has never failed to deliver the bread in the village.
